1.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said:

2.text: How long will ye lay snares for words? Consider, and afterwards we will speak.

3.text: Wherefore are we counted as beasts, And reputed dull in your sight?

4.text: Thou that tearest thyself in thine anger, Shall the earth be forsaken for thee? Or shall the rock be removed out of its place?

5.text: Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, And the spark of his fire shall not shine.

6.text: The light shall be dark in his tent, And his lamp over him shall be put out.

7.text: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, And his own counsel shall cast him down.

8.text: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, And he walketh upon the toils.

9.text: A gin shall take him by the heel, And a snare shall lay hold on him.

10.text: A noose is hid for him in the ground, And a trap for him in the way.

11.text: Terrors shall overwhelm him on every side, And shall entrap him at his feet.

12.text: His trouble shall be ravenous, And calamity shall be ready for his fall.

13.text: It shall devour the members of his body, Yea, the first-born of death shall devour his members.

14.text: That wherein he trusteth shall be plucked out of his tent; And he shall be brought to the king of terrors.

15.text: There shall dwell in his tent that which is none of his; Brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.

16.text: His roots shall dry up beneath, And above shall his branch wither.

17.text: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, And he shall have no name abroad.

18.text: He shall be driven from light into darkness, And chased out of the world.

19.text: He shall have neither son nor sonâ€™s son among his people, Nor any remaining in his dwellings.

20.text: They that come after shall be astonished at his day, As they that went before are affrighted.

21.text: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, And this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
